intro: Tarenna vignei var. vignei, commonly known as the Madagascar tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
